channel.title: Crack3
channel.description:
Uh, another crack thingy? I liked k00dr's ones, so I made my own, just to be leet. As always, 100% hand written, no obfuscators used. I wouldn't even call this a hash collision...but it's something I guess. So, uh... find a key that works?
:)
http://adaada1.hollosite.com/Crack3.class

item.title: Crack3
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Yeah, this thing is a fhkin maze. I gave up because I hate mazes =/

Read full topic

item.title: Crack3
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Copy the code, :-p create a method that returns boolean, replace the output with it… generate a for loop that checks if (methodbrute(hash)) { System.out.println(hash); return; }

I call it the brute forcing method.

Read full topic

item.title: Crack3
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

Heh, I’ve removed the unnecessary instructions, deleted the unconditional “jumping across” and wrote a stack trace, but something doesn’t match.
I’ll crack it the ugly way, once I find time away from studying (I have final exams coming up).

Read full topic

item.title: Crack3
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[quote=“k00dr, post:6, topic:52262”]w00t, I’ll soon get on it… I spent last night with, well, you both actually know who
And STFU aaron, “keeping track of the stack” is what it’s all about.

edit. Unfortunately I’m unable to access your site at the moment, so I guess I’ll “take a bite” of it later. :P[/quote]
Hah, I guess that’s what I get for hosting on a free site.

item.title: Crack3
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Delete the nops, they are a product of crappy compiling :P.
Ya, the stack can get annoying I guess. This isn’t a standard byte[offset] >> 1 type thing though. It’s a little different, which is always good…lel.

I mainly did it because I was bored. I was going to a do threaded one (Two threads passing control to eachother) but I decided that was a waste of time

Read full topic

item.title: Crack3
item.dc:creator: @RLN RLN
item.description:
@RLN wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:3, topic:52262”][quote author=RLN link=topic=73421.msg827759#msg827759 date=1169891063]
theres a point when theres too many swaps and pops and its just gay
just my opinion though
[/quote]
Only a few of them are redundant :). Most are used to keep the whole ‘mis-use the stack’ idea alive.[/quote]I realise that, but like I said: eventually it loses its fun and gets boring and retarded to keep track of the stack
you should re-do it with less pops and nops and use some other technique, something k00dr hasn’t already demonstrated
(just a suggestion :P) I saw the bytecode, and closed my editor at first glance

Read full topic
